intro: Adelobotrys ayangannensis, commonly known as the Ayangannensis starling tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The tree is characterized by its dense foliage, small elliptical leaves, and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that contains a single seed, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various bird and mammal species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is of interest for conservation and botanical research.
